TF030632-DANISH CTF - FY05 (DAC PART
            COUNTRIES GNP PER CAPITA BELOW USD 2,500/AL

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urgent Electricity Rehabilitation
            Project aims to measurably improve the adequacy, efficiency,
            and quality of power supply in the existing network, secure
            Rwanda's future energy supply, by supporting the
            development of domestic resources (methane gas, hydro, or
            other), and, establish a rural energy program framework,
            including rural electrification and traditional fuels.
            Negative measures include: air pollution, noise pollution,
            contamination of soil and ground water sources due to
            accidental or uncontrolled leakage of stored fuels either
            during transportation and/or storage, and aesthetic impact
            on landscape due to transmission grid infrastructure.
            Mitigation measures include: a) monitor air quality and warn
            communities when air commissioning quality is poor and could
            adversely damage their health; b) fuel transportation should
            be safely covered, followed by adequate cleaning of oil,
            and/or lubricant spills. This shall be the contractors'
            responsibility. In accordance with the country's
            environmental regulations, hazardous and harmful substances
            (e.g., asbestos) shall be banned. Working staff will be
            protected with suitable clothing, shoes, and head protection
            gear; c) ensures safe and reliable road transportation of
            fuel. Clean up any leaks. Design safe storage and pumping
            facility for fuel and regular inspection of all piping
            systems form storage tanks to generators; and d) to minimize
            noise disturbances, working schedules should be established
            at daytime hours only.
